Happy 10th Anniversary, Portal 2.

2 Years ago, I started this game and couldn't beat it. I met a friend who asked me to help them get the hardest achievement, 'Still Alive.' And after hours of trying, we got it. 

Yesterday, April 17th 2021, I installed this game again, completely unaware of today's significance. Now that I have had the luxury of beating the game, I can say without a doubt that it is a great experience.
Amazing game.

One of, if not (in my opinion) the best of Valve's games, Portal 2 is by far the best puzzle game I've played, with hilarious writing, unforgettable story, and a suprisingly touching ending. Coupled with visuals that still look good today, really inventive and challenging puzzles, and you've got a game you won't wanna forget for a LONG time.

Ce jeu c'est juste une pépite. Je le conseille fortement, je me suis rarement autant amusé en faisant l'histoire d'un jeu. Le caractère, l'humour des différents personnages, on fini par s'y attacher alors qu'on ne penserait même pas s'y attacher au début du jeu. La difficulté des niveaux qui est bien équilibrée, on apprend à maîtriser les différentes mécaniques du jeu au fur et à mesure qu'on joue, on a la satisfaction d'enfin comprendre un niveau après un petit moment de réflexion, et d'ainsi voir que tout se goupille et qu'on peut enfin passer à la salle suivante. Je recommande fortement ce jeu !

If you're reading this, odds are you just need validation that this game is still as amazing as the first time you played Portal and its mechanically-improved sequel. It is. If you're thinking about it, there really isn't that much to think about. Just play the first one first to see if you like it (its a quick playthrough), otherwise the nuances of the story and general mechanics won't be as appreciated. Worse still - you might actually hate the puzzles halfway through, and can't return the game. 

The game's story never dazzled me, but they did what they could through story, lore, and impeccable voice acting from the likes of Stephen Merchant and J.K. Simmons. The use of new fluid mechanics and ability to show a new side of aperture through digging deeper into Aperture's underground made for some fantastic level design. Scoring and sound effects also killed in a major way - subtle, but always there when you felt like you needed it. 

It is also worth mentioning that this game as added a serious amount of content when compared to its predecessor. A single playthrough will be over twice as long as Portal 1, with more challenging puzzles. Refrain from playthroughs to preserve the wrinkles in your brain. I've also heard that the cooperative section is equally as long, but the campaign was enough puzzle for me.

If you like puzzles, buy it. Sale or not, the franchise belongs in your library.

Also, major shout out to the cloud-based save system Valve has. I initially played the game halfway through on launch, and came back almost ten years later from a different computer. I picked up exactly from where I left off. You love to see it.
